q3B_S8UfNTEASPmjMWu9LQ.text: Should be called Kabab Palace.  I do not understand how you could give this place a mediocre rating.  Really good food served by nice people.  The shawarma were delicious (got the combo; juicy meat, well seasoned with soft, thin lavash and a nice hot sauce for some kick) and the hummus and tabouli were both really excellent.  The mint lemonade, which our guy (the owner?) said was the best thing on the menu, was super refreshing.  A really nice place in a very interesting area of Singapore.  I would definitely check it out.  Not fancy but an excellent spot.  Go.

4z2rx1_rViBQqIFPNGdHVQ.text: Top notch late night 'bab shop!Rolled in here post-midnight after a few snorts of whisky at a hidden bar in Haji Lane. Grabbed a chicken shawarma with hot sauce and all the trimmings. Polished it off right quick, then went back and nailed the lamb one too!Really tasty; Fast friendly service; Slightly pricey at $10-a-go, but at that time of the night do you really care?

ubSSg5IrxQWmYv_3RXMSCA.text: The restaurant is located along Beach Road, across the road from PARKROYAL on Beach Road. The restaurant is open concept, with a few high tables available for al fresco dining. Although it is lunch time the place is not crowded. As I remember the Entertainer mobile has 1-for-1 chicken/lamb/beef shawarma promotion, I decide to use the promotion. The staff allows the promotion but does not allow me to mix the choices. Beef shawarma ($9) is not available. Between chicken shawarma ($8) and lamb shawarma ($9), I decide on lamb shawarma. I could select the vegetables and 2 kinds of sauces for the wraps. For vegetables, I select all which includes shredded lettuce, tomatoes, beans and sliced olives. Out of the 6 kind of sauces, I select garlic and hummus which is highly recommended by the staff.  After wrapping up, the staff lightly toasted the wraps. Although plain looking, the wrap is quite filling with crunchy vegetables and spicy sauce. Quite yummy to have.

photos.caption: Photo of House Of Kebab - Rochor, Singapore, Singapore. lamb shawarma
Photo of House Of Kebab - Rochor, Singapore, Singapore. lamb shawarma
Photo of House Of Kebab - Rochor, Singapore, Singapore

TTd4KJvnimtsm9ZAUOSmFQ.text: Looking at all reviews and wondering if those ppl understand Arabic food? This place is no good. One thing I can tell you, when I ordered a 3 dishes they came different from the picture on the menu.  the pic they have in the menu is just a pic and the food completely different. I was very disappointed when I ordered a plate of hummus and end up with babaghanoj.

keKOiZYwoN1LS_cD__eHMw.text: Nice break from all the Singaporean asian food :-) Located at the corner Arab St and Beach Dr. Nice tasting kebabs and tasty fries. Order at the counter, move to the right and give the cook your receipt. Choose your condiments and sauce. Then go grab a seat to enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of House Of Kebab - Rochor, Singapore, Singapore

zleL4kTSZHx4R3y7cbiCOQ.text: Simple and cheaper than Shiraz. Stick with lamb and do not opt for the hummus. Its not worth that extra S$1.overall, a simple meal and feels like subway's smaller brother but with no processed meats or vegetable patties.

gL5hb4bqT53gN2pcPjgjWA.text: Visiting Singapore and staying on Beach Road this was our very first stop. The appeal was Kebab because we were looking forward to good Turkish kebabs. The last time we had good Turkish food was in Australia. (There is awesome Turkish food in Sydney!) Anyway. The service was good. Both the cashier and the kebab maker were courteous and polite. The food however was underwhelming. Choices are chicken, lamb, mixed, or falafel. Fillings are cabbage, pickle, tomato, onion, cheese. Sauces (all from a squeeze bottle) are chili, garlic, mayo, hummus (did you read squeeze bottle?) , spicy chili, garlic mayo (not a typo), ketchup (what?) Choose meat, fillings, and two sauces. All is put into a pita bread,  wrapped, and pressed into a kebab. It was not a bad meal. It was not the kebab I was expecting. I suggest if you want more of a Lebanese type experience you head a few short steps into Arab or Bussorah street and try one of those restaurants. I mean there is not even tabbouleh or real hummus here.

f4n3uVviOtmVvPliY5bIKg.text: Wandered into Arab Street looking for a quick lunch and happened upon this humble but wonderful establishment. I ordered hummus, pita and falafel... Wow was I surprised with such nice fresh ingredients and service with a smile. Prices can't be beat: e.g., falafel wrap was 6.50 Sing (or about $5 USD) and was quite massive in weight.  They also offer things for the carnivores as well.  Order your food and enjoy it while watching life go by on the avenue perched at one of their shaded tables out front.  They also take cc's. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of House Of Kebab - Rochor, Singapore, Singapore. Sometimes the best things in life come on paper plates!  Falafel wrap.
Photo of House Of Kebab - Rochor, Singapore, Singapore. Hummus and delicious pita.
Photo of House Of Kebab - Rochor, Singapore, Singapore. House of Kebab

6GVpW7-BMEx79XnjQedkpw.text: First time here. Service was very friendly. We had the hummus chicken shawarma for $10, which was a little expensive in my opinion, but it tasted great!
